text: Anyone have a good way to embed Google Reviews on the CMS/
i thought the embedd code was the best way..
i mean, it is the official way, in terms of understanding the code ( for the crawler) that is the Code he is most familiar with
Thanks <@UBT0AHWLD>.  I don’t see an embed code for the reviews.  Can you send a screenshot or a link?  Just to confirm, I’m referring to reviews, and not maps.
Maybe you can also share it via Google My Business?

Is there a way to redirect a user that hits the homepage after having a cookie set to a value of a slug and remove the need for a root page so the homepage essentially just pushed you onto either a recognised cookie value (slug) or a default? Web hooks seemed like the answer but need to know otherwise in case I can do it without upgrading a portal
You could always do a redirect with `window.location` to whatever the correct slug would be based on the cookies

Yeah it was my thinking but wondered if there was a better way instead of loading one page to check the cookie and then redirect and do it server side. Web hooks seemed like the answer but then anything I can’t do in HubSpot through the back end usually requires JS to adjust
Gotcha, yeah there isn’t a way to do server-side redirects that rely on cookie values. You can set up redirects but those are the same for everyone
`if(featuredImageUrl)`
<@U6GNQ7JBU> Thanks for the reply, that was actually what I tried first before checking to see if was an empty string. I can't get either to work :white_frowning_face:
What happens when you print out that value?

I want to add a rich text module in place of the text "title". What is the proper syntax to do this? Rich text module code is {% inline_rich_text field="video_thumbnail_title" value="{{ module.video_thumbnail_title }}" %}

Is there a certain way I should be printing it out to see? If I look at the source attribute or just try to append the value of featuredImageUrl to a p tag or something it will print the word 'undefined', I tried doing a check to see if `featuredImageUrl == 'undefined'` but it never returns true.
`console.log(featuredImageUrl)` and see what the value is? It should be a null value so `if(featuredImageUrl)` should theoretically work

So sorry to sound like a noob, as I mentioned javascript is not my strong suit. When I try to add `console.log(featuredImageUrl)` nothing get's printed to the console. I've tried adding it inside the addResult() function. I also tried adding `console.log(result.featuredImageUrl)` inside the forEach loop in the fillResults() function.
DM your module
If it helps, here is a link to the a search results page I'm using the module on <https://blog.affinityconsulting.com/hs-search-results?term=documents>
thank you!
